body_html:
Seems like security settings on your installation are preventing execution of the command:

patch -p1 -d /serving-1.0/cache/external/protobuf -i /serving-1.0/cache/external/org_tensorflow/third_party/protobuf/add_noinlines.patch'

This doesn't seem to be a TensorFlow issue and unfortunately it is beyond our area of expertise, so I'm going to close the issue. (We currently only support building from source on Ubuntu as per https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources - and alas don't have the bandwidth to support various other Linux distributions).

Perhaps the filesystem you're trying this on has restrictions?

patch -p1 -d /serving-1.0/cache/external/protobuf -i /serving-1.0/cache/external/org_tensorflow/third_party/protobuf/add_noinlines.patch'

This doesn't seem to be a TensorFlow issue and unfortunately it is beyond our area of expertise, so I'm going to close the issue. (We currently only support building from source on Ubuntu as per https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources - and alas don't have the bandwidth to support various other Linux distributions).
Perhaps the filesystem you're trying this on has restrictions?
body:
Seems like security settings on your installation are preventing execution of the command:

```
patch -p1 -d /serving-1.0/cache/external/protobuf -i /serving-1.0/cache/external/org_tensorflow/third_party/protobuf/add_noinlines.patch'
```

This doesn't seem to be a TensorFlow issue and unfortunately it is beyond our area of expertise, so I'm going to close the issue. (We currently only support building from source on Ubuntu as per https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources - and alas don't have the bandwidth to support various other Linux distributions).

Perhaps the filesystem you're trying this on has restrictions?
